```{.r .cell-code}
library(knitr)
```
:::


## Simple linear regression

### Model fitting

Fit model:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
penguins_fit <- linear_reg() %>%
  set_engine("lm") %>%
  fit(body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm, data = penguins)
```
:::


Tidy model output:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tidy(penguins_fit)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 2 × 5
  term              estimate std.error statistic   p.value
  <chr>                <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>
1 (Intercept)        -5781.     306.       -18.9 5.59e- 55
2 flipper_length_mm     49.7      1.52      32.7 4.37e-107
```
:::
:::


Format model output as table:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tidy(penguins_fit) %>%
  kable(digits = 3)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
|term              |  estimate| std.error| statistic| p.value|
|:-----------------|---------:|---------:|---------:|-------:|
|(Intercept)       | -5780.831|   305.815|   -18.903|       0|
|flipper_length_mm |    49.686|     1.518|    32.722|       0|
:::
:::


Augment data with model:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
augment(penguins_fit$fit)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

### Statistical inference
